verses.verse: There was a famine <WH7458> in the land, <WH776> besides <WH905> the first <WH7223> famine <WH7458> that was in the days <WH3117> of Abraham. <WH85> Isaac <WH3327> went <WH3212> to Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines, <WH6430> to Gerar. <WH1642>
Yahweh <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> to him, <WH559> and said, "Don't <WH3381> go down into Egypt. <WH4714> Live <WH7931> in the land <WH776> I will tell you about. <WH559>

Live <WH1481> in this land, <WH776> and I will be with you, <WH1288> and will bless you. <WH2233> For to you, and to your seed, I will give <WH5414> all these <WH411> lands, <WH776> and I will establish <WH6965> the oath <WH7621> which I swore <WH7650> to Abraham <WH85> your father. <WH1>

I will <WH7235> multiply <WH7235> your seed <WH2233> as the stars <WH3556> of the sky, <WH8064> and will give <WH5414> to your seed <WH2233> all these <WH411> lands. <WH776> In your seed <WH2233> will all the nations <WH1471> of the earth <WH776> be blessed, <WH1288>
because <WH6118> Abraham <WH85> obeyed <WH8085> my voice, <WH6963> and kept <WH8104> my requirements, <WH4931> my commandments, <WH4687> my statutes, <WH2708> and my laws. <WH8451>"
Isaac <WH3327> lived <WH3427> in Gerar. <WH1642>

The men <WH582> of the place <WH4725> asked <WH7592> him about his wife. <WH802> He said, <WH559> "She is my sister, <WH269>" for he was afraid <WH3372> to say, <WH559> "My wife, <WH802>" lest, <WH582> he thought, "the men of the place <WH4725> might kill <WH2026> me for Rebekah, <WH7259> because she is beautiful <WH2896> to look at. <WH4758>"

It happened, <WH748> when he had been there a long time, <WH3117> that Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430> looked out <WH8259> at <WH1157> a window, <WH2474> and saw, <WH7200> and, <WH3327> behold, Isaac was caressing <WH6711> Rebekah, <WH7259> his wife. <WH802>

Abimelech <WH40> called <WH7121> Isaac, <WH3327> and said, <WH559> "Behold, <WH389> surely she is your wife. <WH802> Why did you say, <WH559> <WH269> 'She is my sister?'" Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> to him, <WH559> "Because I said, <WH4191> 'Lest I die because of her.'"

Abimelech <WH40> said, <WH559> "What is this you have done <WH6213> to us? <WH259> One of the people <WH5971> might easily <WH4592> have lain <WH7901> with your wife, <WH802> and you would have brought <WH935> guilt on us! <WH817>"
Abimelech <WH40> commanded <WH6680> all the people, <WH5971> saying, <WH559> "He who touches <WH5060> this man <WH376> or his wife <WH802> will surely <WH4191> be put to death. <WH4191>"
Isaac <WH3327> sowed <WH2232> in that land, <WH776> and reaped <WH4672> in the same year <WH8141> one hundred <WH3967> times what he planted. <WH3068> Yahweh blessed him. <WH1288>
The man <WH376> grew great, <WH1431> and grew <WH1432> more <WH3212> and more <WH1980> until he became <WH1431> very <WH3966> great. <WH1431>
He had possessions <WH4735> of flocks, <WH6629> possessions <WH4735> of herds, <WH1241> and a great <WH7227> household. <WH5657> The Philistines <WH6430> envied him. <WH7065>

Now all the wells <WH875> which his father <WH1>'s servants <WH5650> had dug <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father, <WH1> the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped, <WH5640> and filled <WH4390> with earth. <WH6083>
Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559> to Isaac, <WH3327> "Go <WH3212> from us, <WH3966> for you are much mightier than we. <WH6105>"
Isaac <WH3327> departed <WH3212> from there, <WH2583> encamped in the valley <WH5158> of Gerar, <WH1642> and lived <WH3427> there. <WH8033>

Isaac <WH3327> dug <WH2658> again <WH7725> the wells <WH875> of water, <WH4325> which they had dug <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father. <WH1> For the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped <WH5640> them after <WH310> the death <WH4194> of Abraham. <WH85> He called <WH7121> their names <WH8034> after the names <WH8034> by which <WH834> his father <WH1> had called them. <WH7121>
Isaac <WH3327>'s servants <WH5650> dug <WH2658> in the valley, <WH5158> and found <WH4672> there a well <WH875> of springing <WH2416> water. <WH4325>

The herdsmen <WH7462> of Gerar <WH1642> argued <WH7378> with Isaac <WH3327>'s herdsmen, <WH7462> saying, <WH559> "The water <WH4325> is ours. <WH7121>" He called the name <WH8034> of the well <WH875> Esek, <WH6230> because they contended with him. <WH6229>
They dug <WH2658> another <WH312> well, <WH875> and they argued <WH7378> over that, <WH7121> also. He called its <WH8034> name Sitnah. <WH7856>

He left <WH6275> that place, <WH2658> and dug another <WH312> well. <WH875> They didn't <WH7378> argue over that one. <WH7121> He called it <WH8034> Rehoboth. <WH7344> He said, <WH559> "For now <WH6258> Yahweh <WH3068> has made room <WH7337> for us, <WH6509> and we will be fruitful in the land. <WH776>"
He went up <WH5927> from there to Beersheba. <WH884>

Yahweh <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> to him the same night, <WH3915> and said, <WH559> "I am the God <WH430> of Abraham <WH85> your father. <WH1> Don't <WH3372> be afraid, for I am with <WH854> you, <WH1288> and will bless you, <WH7235> and multiply your seed <WH2233> for my servant <WH5650> Abraham <WH85>'s sake."

He built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> there, <WH7121> and called on the name <WH8034> of Yahweh, <WH3068> and pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168> there. <WH3327> There Isaac's servants <WH5650> dug <WH3738> a well. <WH875>
Then Abimelech <WH40> went <WH1980> to him from Gerar, <WH1642> and Ahuzzath <WH276> his friend, <WH4828> and Phicol <WH6369> the captain <WH8269> of his army. <WH6635>
Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> to them, <WH4069> "Why have you come <WH935> to me, <WH8130> since you hate me, <WH7971> and have sent me away from you?"

They said, <WH559> "We saw <WH7200> plainly <WH7200> that Yahweh <WH3068> was with you. <WH559> We said, <WH423> 'Let there now be an oath between <WH996> us, <WH996> even between us and you, <WH3772> and let us make a covenant with you, <WH1285>

that you will do <WH6213> us no harm, <WH7451> as we have not touched <WH5060> you, <WH6213> and as we have done to you nothing but <WH7535> good, <WH2896> and have sent you away <WH7971> in peace. <WH7965>' You are now <WH6258> the blessed <WH1288> of Yahweh. <WH3068>"
He made <WH6213> them a feast, <WH4960> and they ate <WH398> and drank. <WH8354>

They rose up some time <WH7925> in the morning, <WH1242> and swore <WH7650> one <WH376> to another. <WH251> Isaac <WH3327> sent them away, <WH7971> and they departed <WH3212> from him in peace. <WH7965>

It happened the same day, <WH3117> that Isaac <WH3327>'s servants <WH5650> came, <WH935> and told <WH5046> him concerning <WH182> the well <WH875> which they had dug, <WH2658> and said <WH559> to him, <WH4672> "We have found water. <WH4325>"
He called <WH7121> it Shibah. <WH7656> Therefore the name <WH8034> of the city <WH5892> is Beersheba <WH884> to this day. <WH3117>

When Esau <WH6215> was forty <WH705> years <WH8141> old, <WH1121> he took <WH3947> as wife <WH802> Judith, <WH3067> the daughter <WH1323> of Beeri <WH882> the Hittite, <WH2850> and Basemath, <WH1315> the daughter <WH1323> of Elon <WH356> the Hittite. <WH2850>
They grieved <WH4786> Isaac <WH3327>'s and Rebekah <WH7259>'s spirits. <WH7307>
